course.title: Social Anthropology Research Methods in Museum Collections
course.faculty_text: Richard H. Meadow (fall term) and Ramyar Dagoberto Rossoukh (spring term)
course.description: Special (individual) study of Peabody Museum collections directly supervised by a faculty member and a member of the curatorial staff. Requires a project involving a Harvard Museum collection, developed in consultation with the supervisors.
course.notes: Must be taken for a letter grade. Priority given to students in Anthropology and related departments. To enroll, submit a petition form (available from the Undergraduate Office, Tozzer 103B), signed by both supervisors, a proposed research agenda, during the term preceding the term of enrollment. Information sheets with Museum contacts available in Tozzer 103B.
